{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-161-09-A
|Item_parent=Urinary infections in children and adults
|Item_parent_short=Urinary infections in children and adults
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the diagnostic criteria for acute pyelonephritis (clinical, biological, radiological) with or without signs of severity (algorithm).
|Description=Know the difference between simple pyelonephritis and pyelonephritis at risk of complication, know how to recognise the risks of complications in pyelonephritis, know which additional examinations to carry out in the event of pyelonephritis, whether as an emergency or as a delayed procedure, know how to determine the indication for referral; know how to eliminate differential diagnoses.
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=Maxime Vallée, Alice Faure
|Order=9}}



● The clinical presentation is that of [[Acute fever in children and adults|unilateral febrile lumbar pain 147]] in the absence of any lower urinary tract symptoms (the ''E. coli'' responsible for ANP are not the same as those responsible for cystitis)

● Pain frequently associated with nausea or vomiting linked to reflex ileus

● Radiation of pain (renal colic pain) should suggest a urinary tract obstruction, which is a diagnostic and therapeutic emergency.

● [[Sepsis/Bacteremia/Fungemia in adults and children|clinical severity 157]] and [[Sepsis and septic shock in children and adults|158]] being defined by the previously described criteria (obstructive, sepsis, septic shock, qSOFA 2 or 3, need for renal urine drainage). Acute obstructive pyelonephritis is, by definition, severe acute pyelonephritis. It is also known as febrile renal colic (if painful).

question.title: What is the definition of acute obstructive pyelonephritis?
question.description: What is the relationship between acute obstructive pyelonephritis and other types of pyelonephritis?

option_a.title: A type of pyelonephritis that is not associated with urinary tract obstruction
option_a.description: A type of pyelonephritis that is not typically painful

option_b.title: A type of pyelonephritis that is characterized by the presence of urinary tract obstruction
option_b.description: A type of pyelonephritis that is a diagnostic and therapeutic emergency

option_c.title: A type of pyelonephritis that is similar to simple pyelonephritis
option_c.description: A type of pyelonephritis that is typically mild and not associated with complications

option_d.title: A type of pyelonephritis that is the same as febrile renal colic
option_d.description: A type of pyelonephritis that is characterized by the presence of sepsis or septic shock
